p: In striking contrast, common variants from PSP GWAS ( HÃ¶glinger et al., 2011) were significantly enriched in the early neuronal, C1 module ( Figure 6A) and the overlapping Mayo proteomics P4 module ( Figure 6B) and Mayo transcriptomic, T1, module ( Figure 6C). These analyses illustrate two major points: (1) genetic risk enriches in modules with early changes in disease, consistent with the causal role of genetic risk variants; and (2) causal risk variants in these two tauopathies associated with dementia (AD and PSP) differ in terms of the specific biology and cell types that they causally impact ( Figure 6D).
